page.title: 17THE ANNUAL FLOOD
page.content: DIDN'T HAVE TO GO TO THE SHOPS BECAUSE THEY HAD STOCKED UP FOR TWO OR THREE WEEKS KNOWING THE USUAL DURATION OF THE FLOOD. WHEN THE RIVER DON ROSE AFTER A VERY BAD WINTER IT SOMETIMES FLOODED THE VILLAGE OF FISHLAKE AND WHEN THE FLOOD CAME EVERYBODY MOVED THEIR BELONGINGS UPSTAIRS AND STOCKED UP WITH FOOD FOR TWO OR THREE WEEKS. THE POSTMAN CAME IN A ROWING BOAT TO THE HOUSES, SHOPS AND FARMS WHICH WERE AFFECTED BY THE FLOOD. MEN HAD TO ROW TO STAINFORTH FOR FRESH BREAD. MANY PEOPLE PUT BEER BARRELS AND PLANKS ON THE PAVEMENT AND ACROSS THE ROAD SO PEOPLE COULD GET ABOUT. THEY WERE CALLED WALKWAYS. AFTER THE FLOOD HAD DRIED UP IT LEFT A LOT OF SMELLY ROOMS. SINCE 1630 WORK HAS BEEN GOING ON TO IMPROVE THE RIVER DRAINAGE. FOLLOWING THE FLOOD OF 1947 A NEW FLOOD BANK WAS BUILT. SINCE THEN THE
